intro: Malcolmia broussonetii var. canescens, commonly known as the sand mustard, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is adapted to hot, dry climates and has a deep root system to access water. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing sandy soils.
